benchmark_details.name: UrBLiMP (Urdu Benchmark of Linguistic Minimal Pairs)
benchmark_details.overview: UrBLiMP is a syntactically informed benchmark for evaluating the linguistic competence of multilingual language models in Urdu, comprising 5,696 minimal pairs targeting ten core syntactic phenomena.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a linguistically grounded tool for identifying systematic weaknesses in LLMs' understanding of Urdu grammar.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The evaluation of linguistic phenomena in Urdu was limited primarily by the availability of annotated data.

data.source: Urdu Treebank and in-house Urdu Corpus
data.annotation: Manual verification by native Urdu speakers with inter-annotator agreement of 96.10%.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is defined as the proportion of minimal pairs in which the model assigns a lower (pseudo-)perplexity to the grammatically acceptable sentence.
methodology.interpretation: Higher accuracy indicates better understanding of the Urdu linguistic phenomena.
methodology.validation: Inter-annotator agreement was assessed, yielding a 96.10% agreement rate.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The benchmark includes evaluation of models on various demographic factors.
